headline: Why Lam Research (LRCX) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of semiconductor equipment maker Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) jumped 4.1% in the afternoon session after Morgan Stanley analyst Joseph Moore upgraded the company's stock from an Underweight to an Equal-Weight rating.

raw.headline: Why Lam Research (LRCX) Stock Is Trading Up Today
raw.summary: Shares of semiconductor equipment maker Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) jumped 4.1% in the afternoon session after Morgan Stanley analyst Joseph Moore upgraded the company's stock from an Underweight to an Equal-Weight rating.

headline: Chip Equipment Sales Are Booming. These Two Stocks Just Got an Upgrade.
summary: The analysts moved Lam to Equal-weight from Underweight and boosted their price target to $125 from $92.  Shares of Applied Materials were up 4% to $197.84.  The recent turnaround in the memory wafer fab equipment, or WFE, market triggered the revision, Morgan Stanley said.

headline: ASML Invests 1.3B Euro in Mistral AI: Will it Deliver Growth?
summary: ASML Holding is investing 1.3B Euro in Mistral AI for an 11% stake, aiming to boost lithography tools and long-term chipmaking growth.

headline: AMAT Trades 54% Above Its 52-Week Low: Time to Hold or Fold the Stock?
summary: Applied Materials rides DRAM strength and R&D push, but China headwinds, weak memory demand and rivals weigh on its outlook.

headline: Is Lam Research (LRCX) a Buy as Wall Street Analysts Look Optimistic?
summary: According to the average brokerage recommendation (ABR), one should invest in Lam Research (LRCX). It is debatable whether this highly sought-after metric is effective because Wall Street analysts' recommendations tend to be overly optimistic. Would it be worth investing in the stock?

headline: Morgan Stanley revisits semicap calls: AMAT, LAM lifted; KLAC downgraded
summary: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley has reshuffled its ratings on U.S. semiconductor capital equipment stocks, revising its industry outlook alongside an upgraded forecast for wafer fab equipment (WFE) spending in 2026.
